thread.title: A Chic Toddler Room Fit For a Sweet Little Princess
thread.title_full: A Chic Toddler Room Fit For a Sweet Little Princess

author: Shari Wargo Stamps
title: A Chic Toddler Room Fit For a Sweet Little Princess
text:
Pink Princess Butterfly Room For Girls A Chic Toddler Room Fit For a Sweet Little Princess February 25, 2017   A Chic Toddler Room Fit For a Sweet Little Princess 
Looking for a fairy-tale room that's practical for your budget, and your toddler? Take a look at this pretty in pink butterfly princess toddler bedroom. It's fun, functional, and adorable! From a pint-sized chandelier to floating butterflies and beautiful books, this room is full of sweet dreams (and tips). Around The Web What’s Your Reaction? Thanks for your reaction Don’t forget to share this with your friends! 0 Reactions Sign Up For Our Newsletter Select topics that interest you Parenting News sstamps 2 years @kee81, I'm so glad you love it! I no-longer work at POPSUGAR so I just happened to see your comment when looking at my article (originally posted as a slideshow) again. I used Sprout 6 from YOLO Colorhouse for the pink paint. There's a link to it in the article. Since it isn't available at most stores I ordered it through Amazon Prime and paid less than the stores with free shipping (I repainted the whole house so this saved me on carrying 30 gallons of paint all over the place). For the white chalkboard paint I purchased a half gallon of oops YOLO paint from an eco paint store in Berkeley that sells YOLO (so I could see colors in person). Their oops paint was cheaper, but the galloons were too expensive and would have taken longer to order than my Amazon route. The window treatments are Shabby Chic from Target, and the butterfly curtain rods are also from Target. keek81 3 years I am obsessed with this room! Can you tell me what color paint you used and where you got the window valances? Also, did you find that the twin comforter worked with the toddler bed? Related Posts
